wikipedia_page.main: Frances ("Fanny") Elizabeth Deacon (née Potter) (1837–1930) was an English chemist and druggist who was the first woman to qualify after the 1868 Pharmacy Act, which made registration with the Pharmaceutical Society of Great Britain (PSGB) compulsory in order to work as a pharmacist.

response: *Frances Elizabeth Potter, the first woman in the UK to qualify as a pharmacist
